comments: With leading zero, binomial transform of A002450. - _Paul Barry_, Apr 11 2003The sequence of fractions a(n)/(n+1) is the 3rd binomial transform of the sequence of fractions J(n+1)/(n+1) where J(n) is A001045(n). - _Paul Barry_, Aug 05 2005Equals term (1,2) in M^n, M = the 3x3 matrix [1, 1, 3; 1, 3, 1; 3, 1, 1]. a(n)/ a(n-1) tends to 5, a root to the charpoly x^3 - 5x^2 -4x + 20. [From _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 12 2009]

formula: a(n) =(5^(n+1)-2^(n+1))/3 = sum(0<=i<=n, 5^i*2^(n-1) ) = 5*a(n-1)+2^n =2*a(n-1)+5^n. - _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 07 2003Binomial transform of A020989. - _Paul Barry_, May 18 2003a(n) = sum(k=0..n, sum(j=0..n, 5^(n-j)*binomial(j, k) ) ); a(n)=sum(k=0..n, 2^k*5^(n-k) ) = sum(k=0..n, 5^k*2^(n-k) ); - _Paul Barry_, Aug 05 2005For n>2, a(n) = 9*a(n-1) - 24*a(n-2) + 20*a(n-3). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Dec 26 2007
